text: Bloomington Cemetery, historically called the First Presbyterian Church of Oak Grove Cemetery, is a cemetery in Bloomington, Minnesota, United States. Established in 1856, its pioneer and Dakota burials and 1890 soldiers' monument reflect the city's transition from frontier settlement to participant in state affairs like military service. Missionary Gideon Pond is buried there. ==References== ==External links== * Bloomington City Cemetery Category:1856 establishments in Minnesota Territory Category:Cemeteries on the National Register of Historic Places in Minnesota Category:National Register of Historic Places in Hennepin County, Minnesota
title: Bloomington Cemetery
